meaningMnemonic: On the <radical>grass</radical> near a <radical>rice paddy</radical> sits a <radical>creeper</radical> that is some sort of a <radical>dog</radical> <kanji>beast</kanji>, a vicious <kanji>animal</kanji>. This creeper isn’t just a normal dog, it is more beast-like, more like a feral animal than domesticated pet.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>beast</kanji> is guarding its precious <reading>jew</reading>els (じゅう), which it buried in the grass or the rice paddy somewhere. If you don't want the beast to think you're coming to steal those jewels, you better keep your distance.
